{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33454].
  {panel}

This was cloned from JRA-33704 which had the same issues. The remedy is to change the URL:

http://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-55/whatsnew/iframe

To be:

It should be:

https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-55/whatsnew/iframe

----


h3. Steps to reproduce
# Setup JIRA with Apache proxy and SSL
# Access JIRA with one new user which has never login before (via IE10 or Google Chrome internet browser)
# The What's New Content (JIRA Welcome page) will show something like below:
!1.jpg!

h3. According to customer analysing:
This seems to be an issue with the linked iframe content that is redirected to content that is http. Since it redirects from https to http back to https, the internet browser wont show it as http is considered unsecure Iframe content.
Please refer to the following screenshots: [^screenshot-1.jpg] and [^screenshot-2.jpg]
fields.summary: what's new content(Confluence Welcome page) not working if Confluence is running behind proxy and configured with SSL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33425].
  {panel}

As a Confluence administrator I would like to easily search through my user database based on a number of factors. Some of these could include:
* Last login date (e.g., show me all users who haven't logged in in 180 days).
* People who are a member of one group but not another (e.g., who is in "QA" but not "UK-QA").
* List all users who can access a specified space (i.e., by virtue of being a member of a certain group which has permission).

Ideally I'd like some sort of way running a query string against the user database. I used to be able to do this using a user macro but since my user base has grown to nearly 2000 users, the operation times out before completion (in any case, a search like this was very inefficient, often taking minutes).

Finally, if possible, I'd then like the ability to perform bulk operations on the results but that's probably a whole different request.
fields.summary: Enable Administrators to Query User Database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33424].
  {panel}

I am using Confluence-Jaxb version 2.1 (http://confluence.highsource.org/display/HJ3/JAXB) to generate Java beans for the XSD below. Java source code is properly generated but JAXB is not able to successfully unmarshal a valid XML file conforming to the XSD. I have provided below the XSD, my conformant XML file, and my Java code used to unmarshal.

My specific problem is as below. I am using a custom Java class named com.tree.JAXBLeafNode for the element LeafNode in the XSD and have provided corresponding JaxB annotations to NOT generate Java beans for this element. I have also provided a custom XmlAdapter to marshal/unmarshal the element LeafNode. My custom marshal/unmarshaling handles converting the XML attributes appearing in the element LeafNode into some custom Java objects. LeafNode's parent element RootOrInnerNode, however, has the standard confluence-JAXB generated - Java beans. It has a List<JAXBElement<?>> to hold the contained LeafNode elements. It should be noted that, in the XSD, LeafNode's parent element RootOrInnerNode only contains the element AbstractNode as a direct child element and not the element LeafNode itself. LeafNode is rather indirectly rendered as a child of RootOrInnerNode since it is a substitution group for the element AbstractNode. Upon inspection using eclipse's debugger, I discovered that the List<JAXBElement<?>> in RootOrInnerNode contains a  null for the LeafNodes. It appears that my custom XMLAdapter for the element LeafNode is not called, while instantiating its parent element RootOrInnerNode's JAXB bean and hence, the List<JAXBElement<?>> is not populated with the corresponding LeafNodes

I have these constraints upon the XSD and custom Java bean,Adapter and marshal/unmarshall methods, while fixing this error. 1) I cannot change the schema. AbstractNode must exist the way it is in the XSD and both the RootOrInnerNode and LeafNode should have the existing associations with AbstractNode. This is the case since changing the XSD triggers lot bigger changes in several other parts of the project. 2) I must use custom Java beans named com.tree.JAXBLeafNode for the element LeafNode and a custom XMLAdapter since, I expect the binary data anyAttribute namespace=="##any" in the LeafNode element and do a lot of custom processing of this data.

Would be of great help if I can obtain a way to generate the right LeafNode objects into the List<JAXBElement<?>> in RootOrInnerNode.
fields.summary: Does not parse List<JaxbElement<?>> with a child element using custom XMLAdapter

I would like to be able to print a hardcopy of an entire wiki, or even better select different pages/"chapters" of a wiki.  This feature is in Wikipedia and is so useful for building "books" of knowledge on a specific topic.

I've looked through the documentation for our version of Atlassian Confluence (2.8.0) and have not found this feature.

I'm able to print pages separately, but creating a .pdf of entire wiki would be very, very useful for giving to customers (who can't access our internal servers) or just for archiving a hard copy.

A logical place to add this might be in the "tree view" portion of the administration page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33391].
  {panel}

I'm a PM responsible for introducing Confluence to 900 users on a pilot basis, with the potential to extend this to ~30,000 users.  

My organisation's senior management write blog posts, and these are editable by all other users.  There is no way to "restrict editing" like we can with other content.  It should be possible to prevent unauthorised changes to blogs - I'm unable to extend the pilot any further without this facility being available.

The user story would be: "As a VIP user, I want to limit who can modify my posts, so that I can preserve the integrity of my content".

I envisage this being done through the "restrictions" tab, or through an "edit own" / "edit all" permission in the usergroup permissions.
fields.summary: Users are able to modify blogs written by other people

We found this bug by having the following problem:

We couldn't mention an *specific* user (doris.doppelbauer) within Confluence by using @user while creating or editing a page.

If you have any further questions, please go ahead and ask me. Please fix this issue as soon as possible, as we need to mention users for our workflow.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33329].
  {panel}

Due to  how Confluence is build, schema updates can happen any time when the instance is up and running especially for plugins, including third party plugins operation.

This made specific database configuration where Confluence can only use regular account that unable to updates database schema not possible.

In order to workaround this, Confluence should provide a feature that could delay all schema updates and trigger at the same time when the administrator prefer.

In regards to plugin installation process, Confluence could mark this plugin as inactive until all the necessary process to complete its installation are triggered at the same time as the other schema updates process.

*Possible Implementation*

A new queue menu under JIRA administrators could be implemented for this feature. Like Mail Queue menu, administrators have the privilege to see the pending task that need to be run and administrator can choose which task to run individually or the whole queue at the same time
fields.summary: Delay All Schema Updates and Trigger it at The Same Time

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33297].
  {panel}

if you are trying to write a template for use with the AutoExport plugin, and you need access to the exported URL of an arbitrary AbstractPage (ie: the current page, or any of it's children) for any reason (in my current situation: to pass as a query param in an ifram for an external service) there is no way to do this (from the template):
$page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
$autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)
It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())
fields.summary: Autoexport - method for accessing (relative) url for exported page(s) from template

* $page.urlPath (java: AbstractPage.getUrlPath()) is the pre-exported path in confluence
* $autoexport.link($page) (java: ExportUtils.link(AbstractPage)) generates an <a href=""/> for the page, still using the pre-exported path
* ExportBeautifier will look for html nodes with "href" and "src" attributes and convert the paths, but it won't look for paths in arbitrary text (ie: script bodies, escaped in iframe params, etc...)

It would be helpful if some object was made available in the VelocityContext that had a simple method for retrieving the final exported (relative) url of an arbitrary AbstractPage as a String, which could then be included in the response as is (or if necessary for passing as an argument in some other url, escaped using $generalUtil.urlEncode())
fields.summary: Autoexport plugin - Method for accessing (relative) url for exported page(s) from template

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33283].
  {panel}

It would be real help ful if events/audits were logged when a page(s) is moved.

We have had someone moving pages and cannot determine who is doing this because nothing is logged(Event or audit) 
It would be good if when someone is moving a page that it is logged and also becomes part of the page history

So who is doing the move(What user)
where the page is currently(prior to the move), and where they are moving the page too (New location)..
timestamp too
fields.summary: Create Event / Audit trial log when moving a page or pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33281].
  {panel}

Having an attachments macro with a label filter leads to a confusing behavior for end users:

* They D&D files to the macro view and the file are not shown, because non of them have the required label attached
* They may repeat this multiple times (generating multiple versions) and finally give up

A better behavior would be to let the macro with the label filter apply the respective label(s) when files are attached through their upload area.
fields.summary: Attachments macro should behave smarter with labels
Include the option to list number of likes and comments in the search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33279].
  {panel}

I have created a draft page for proposals, with a child page for each chapter, sub-chapter, etc. so my colleagues and I can collaboratively create proposals.
Every page has a prefix "Prop - " to show that this is the proposal master.
On parent pages, I included the child pages one by one so a chapter can also be read all in one on the parent page.

For each new proposal, the whole master-page with all child pages shall be copied with "Copy Page Tree" and the "Prop - " prefix is replaced during the process.

My issue now is: The page include macro doesn't change during the copy process and still points to the master draft and I would need to change all (about 100 for each proposal) to the new pages.

Can the page include be improved by a functionality "include all child pages on the next page level", which allows to include all direct child pages on the parent page?
eg.: the page "1.parent" shall include "1.1.child 1" and "1.2.child 2" but not "1.1.1.sub-child 1".
fields.summary: Include-page should include all child pages on one page-level below

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33276].
  {panel}

At the moment we can create a page from a template, but there is no way of creating a 'skeleton' of pages. This would allow admins to create skeleton projects, which could then be filled in by the users.

For example, you might have a number of skeletons:

* Project1 skeleton
** Home page
** Meeting page - meetings template
** Sales page - decision template
* Project2 skeleton
** Home page
** Etc
** Etc
* Etc
fields.summary: Skeleton page sets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33249].
  {panel}

Customers often will use their Confluence as a public facing, anonymously accessible documentation source.

In these sorts of situations, Confluence can be subjected to higher than normal traffic loads. We've seen some cases in support where customer facing instances were having increased load being generated by the Quick Reload plugin - the plugin that's responsible for letting a user know when a new comment has been added to the page.

At the moment, we have two [potential workarounds|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=588581674] for dealing with this issue, however, some customers may want the functionality that Confluence provides for logged in users, while disabling it for anonymous users.

I'd like to suggest an improvement, either:

# Being able to disable this endpoint for anonymous users if required
# Being able to increase the time out between checks to the endpoint.

Either of these improvements would be a small but helpful change for customers who have their Confluence instance accessible to the public.
fields.summary: The quick reload plugin can generate too much load
System information can be confirmed to customers

fields.summary: Restoring page version causes an error
Favicon per space, rather than instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33244].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
Some usernames aren't autocompleted when mentioning or assigning a task to a user.

*Cause:*
When adding Confluence to a JIRA Cloud instance, users are not properly migrated over.
This also causes [Duplicates in the People Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicates+in+the+People+Directory] (covered by this bug [CONF-9857|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-9857])

*Steps to reproduce:*
# create a JIRA only instance
# add users
# add Confluence to the instance
# grant access to the users
# try to mention a user that was created previously (before they access Confluence for the first time) accessing just JIRA won't update the 'content' table.
Created users won't be displayed in the People directory although they are Confluence users with access.
Once the user logs in to Confluence, the user is mentionable.

*Expected:* users are mentionable because they have Confluence access
*Actual:* users are not mentionable

*Temporary Workarounds:*
* Manually run a Content Reindex 
(due to [CONF-33400 - Confluence Administrators unable to Reindex Manually|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33400] please contact support at http://support.atlassian.com to run the Content Reindex)
* Login the user to Confluence
* Visit their Profile page manually by changing the username on another Profile page.
fields.summary: User autocomplete not finding all users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33241]. {panel} Now it is impossible to add multilevel numbering to the page headings in multipage PDF export. It is because of enclosing page's heading elements (that may be demoted to h1,h2,h3,...h7 during page hierarchy building when exporting) into the div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle. That's why calling smth. like h1 { counter-reset: h1-title; } has no meaning because it will create a new instance of h1-title counter in the parent element div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle and will be popd after it is closed. And when a new div.wiki-content element (a new page) will be opened there will be a untouched counter value. Please add a class to the div.wiki-content element that can classify the heading level (h1,h2,..h7) of the page title of the enclosed content (actually it will be enaught to copy the name of the type of the first child of the div.wiki-content > div.pagetitle element). Something like this:

Main topic

....

Subpage title

You can check the difference in this JS Fiddle: http://jsfiddle.net/9pJdS/4/ (see the css to point the feature use)
fields.summary: Please add a class specifying the resulting heading level of the title of the page to the div.wiki-content element
test
No way of determining if a user is a Confluence administrator through the remote api(s)
Highlight searchtext on resultpage
Widget Connector macro has fixed Height and Width values which prevent from auto resize
Create a "Blue Print" of your Experience Canvas
Where Confluence is using the Jira User Directory it should pick up the user's profile picture from Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33214].
  {panel}

In CONF-7612 we solved the issue of attachments in the Editor by no longer sending notifications for that event.

This ticket is to deal with the notification storms that can be generated by attachments being added to the view page through multiple scenarios including:

* Uploading many attachments at once
* Multiple small changes being made to a file and having it continually uploaded
* Updating a Gliffy Diagram

If you have other examples, please leave a comment.
fields.summary: Attaching files to the view page generates notification noise
